

<task>
<question_img>http://<LU LEMMA="open" CAT="A">open</LU>.ifmo.ru/<LU LEMMA="image" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="p">images</LU>/0/07/2268851_dif30p.gif</question_img>
<question>
A <LU LEMMA="screen" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">screen</LU> with a <LU LEMMA="changeable" CAT="A">changeable</LU> <LU LEMMA="aperture" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">aperture</LU> is set between a <LU LEMMA="point" CAT="A">point</LU> <LU LEMMA="source" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">source</LU> S and a <LU LEMMA="point" CAT="A">point</LU> of <LU LEMMA="observance" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">observance</LU> P. <LU LEMMA="amplitude" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">Amplitude</LU> in P corresponds to the <LU LEMMA="vector" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">vector</LU> AB1 if the <LU LEMMA="radius" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">radius</LU> of the <LU LEMMA="aperture" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">aperture</LU> is R. If the <LU LEMMA="amplitude" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">amplitude</LU> now corresponds to the <LU LEMMA="vector" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">vector</LU> AB2, what is the <LU LEMMA="change" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">change</LU> of R?
</question>
<answers>
<answer right="no">	R decreased by 1.29 times.</answer>
<answer right="yes">R increased by 1.29 times.</answer>
<answer right="no">	R increased by 1.67 times.</answer>
<answer right="no">	R decreased by 1.73 times.</answer>
<answer right="no">	R increased by 1.73 times.</answer>
<answer right="no">	No right answer.</answer>
</answers>
